org.threadly.concurrent

Class NoThreadScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.concurrent.NoThreadScheduler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Executor, SimpleSchedulerInterface, SubmitterSchedulerInterface

    public class NoThreadScheduler
extends java.lang.Object
implements SubmitterSchedulerInterface
    Executor which has no threads itself. This can be useful for testing. It has the same semantics that it only progressed forward with .tick(), but since it is running on the calling thread, calls to .wait() and .sleep() will block (possibly forever).

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • NoThreadScheduler

        public NoThreadScheduler()
        Constructs a new thread safe scheduler.

      • NoThreadScheduler

        public NoThreadScheduler(boolean makeThreadSafe)
        Constructs a new thread scheduler. Making scheduler thread safe causes some small additional performance reductions (for when that is important). Passing in a false expects that it is always the same thread which is adding tasks, removing tasks, and calling tick. The only operation which is always thread safe is the handling of Futures.
        Parameters:
        makeThreadSafe - Make scheduler able to accept executions from multiple threads

      • submit

        public ListenableFuture<?> submit(java.lang.Runnable task)
        Description copied from interface: SubmitterSchedulerInterface
        Submit a task to run as soon as possible. There is a slight increase in load when using submit over execute. So this should only be used when the future is necessary. The future .get() method will return null once the runnable has completed.
        Specified by:
        submit in interface SubmitterSchedulerInterface
        Parameters:
        task - runnable to be executed
        Returns:
        a future to know when the task has completed

                          long initialDelay,
                          long recurringDelay)
        Description copied from interface: SimpleSchedulerInterface
        Schedule a recurring task to run. The recurring delay time will be from the point where execution finished.
        Specified by:
        scheduleWithFixedDelay in interface SimpleSchedulerInterface
        Parameters:
        task - runnable to be executed.
        initialDelay - delay in milliseconds until first run.
        recurringDelay - delay in milliseconds for running task after last finish.

        public boolean isShutdown()
        Description copied from interface: SimpleSchedulerInterface

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        true if thread pool is running

      • tick

        public int tick()
        Progresses tasks for the current time. This will block as it runs as many scheduled or waiting tasks as possible.
        Returns:
        qty of steps taken forward. Returns zero if no events to run.

      • tick

        public int tick(long currentTime)
        This progresses tasks based off the time provided. This is primarily used in testing by providing a possible time in the future (to execute future tasks).
        Parameters:
        currentTime - - Time to provide for looking at task run time
        Returns:
        qty of steps taken forward. Returns zero if no events to run.
